SHORT_DESCR.P: EIT Health seeks to select a capable economic operator for crowdfunding services to enter into a cooperation agreement for a duration of up to five years. This agreement shall comprise in particular:

— the operator delivering the services described in this document and the concession documents (Operation of crowdfunding platform including communication; set-up and organize an investment committee; implementation of legal framework and regulatory processes; deployment of the overall IT system for the crowdfunding platform etc.),
— EIT Health providing a high-value pipeline of startups.

TEXT.P: See section 4.2.2.4.1 of the document “EIT Health - Concession documents - FINAL.pdf” (link: https://fileshare.eithealth.eu/url/cf)
The following documents (self-declarations, proofs /certificates and /or other supporting documents) must be submitted together with the initial tender:

1— Self-declaration that no person whose conduct is attributable to the tenderer or a member of the group of tenderers has been convicted, or a fine has been legally established against the company pursuant to Section 30 OWiG, for an offense as stated in Section 123 (1) to (3) GWB.
2— Self-declaration that the applicant has fulfilled his obligation to pay taxes, duties and social security contributions (§ 123 (4) GWB).
3— Self-declaration (according to § 124 GWB) that:

a— neither the applicant's company nor any person whose conduct is attributable to the applicant has failed to fulfill its obligations under environmental, social or labor law when executing public contracts,

b— the applicant's company is not insolvent, insolvency proceedings or similar proceedings have not been instituted or opened for the assets of the applicant's company, the opening of such proceedings has not been refused for lack of assets, and the company is not in liquidation or has ceased its activity,
c— neither the applicant's company nor any person whose conduct is attributable to the company has been guilty of grave professional misconduct that calls into question the integrity of the company,

d— neither the company nor any person whose conduct is attributable to the company has entered into agreements with other undertakings which have the effect of preventing, restricting or distorting competition,

e— the entity has not materially or consistently fulfilled a material breach in the execution of a previous public procurement or concession contract, resulting in termination, damages or similar legal consequences.
For further details see section 4.2.2.4.1 of the document "EIT Health - Concession documents - FINAL.pdf" in the most recent version (link: https://fileshare.eithealth.eu/url/cf).
See section 4.2.2.4.1 of the document “EIT Health - Concession documents - FINAL.pdf” (link: https://fileshare.eithealth.eu/url/cf)
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
See section 4.2.2.4.1 of the document “EIT Health - Concession documents - FINAL.pdf” (link: https://fileshare.eithealth.eu/url/cf)
The following documents (self-declarations, proofs/certificates and / or other supporting documents) must be submitted together with the initial tender:
1— Proof (confirmation of insurance or certificate) of an existing professional liability insurance of the applicant
a— with a coverage of at least 5 000 000 EUR for personal injury and of at least 5 000 000 EUR for propertydamage and financial loss,
b— the maximization of the compensation must be at least twice the amount covered per calendar year,

Issued by an insurance undertaking authorized in one of the Member States of the EU or one of the contracting states to the agreement on the European economic area. In the case of lesser coverage sums or less maximization of the compensation than mentioned under a) -b) above, a confirmation from the insurance

Company has to be submitted stating that in case of the award of the concession to the applicant the insurance will be adjusted to the requirements mentioned under a) -b). In the case of a group of tenderers, proof of and corresponding confirmation of insurance must be provided by each member of the tenderers’ group. The above requirements according to 1. a) -b) are minimum requirements.

2— Self-declaration of total turnover and turnover for comparable services of the tenderer (turnover generated through the operation of an online platform for corporate finance in the healthcare sector) in the last 3 completed financial years (2015-2017), each in EUR net. The minimum requirement is an average annual turnover of the tenderer for comparable services in the last 3 completed financial years (2015-2017) of at least net 25 000 EUR per year or a total turnover of at least net 75 000 over these three years. If the minimum requirement is not met, the initial offer is excluded.
For further details see section 4.2.2.4.1 of the document “EIT Health — Concession documents - FINAL.pdf” in the most recent version (link: https://fileshare.eithealth.eu/url/cf).
See section 4.2.2.4.1 of the document “EIT Health - Concession documents - FINAL.pdf” (link: https://fileshare.eithealth.eu/url/cf)
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required:
See section 4.2.2.4.1 of the document “EIT Health - Concession documents - FINAL.pdf” (link: https://fileshare.eithealth.eu/url/cf)
The following documents (self-declarations, proofs/certificates and /or other supporting documents) must be submitted together with the initial tender:

1— Self-declaration stating the annual average (number) of salaried employees (including founders /managing directors) of the tenderer in each of the last 3 completed financial years (2015-2017), as well as designation of employees with expertise in financing start-ups in the fields of medical technology, biotechnology or digital

Health, as well as proof of this expertise. In the case of a group of tenderers, the respective annual appropriations for the members of the consortium members must be added for each completed financial year (2015-2017).

Minimum requirement is an annual average of at least 1.5 full-time equivalent employees with expertise in financing start-ups in the medical technology, biotechnology or digital health sectors in each of the last 3 completed financial years (2015-2017). If the minimum requirement is not met, the initial offer is excluded.

2— Self-declaration (according to the following requirements) of reference projects as specified below, stating the name /address of each start-up and the name, telephone number and e-mail address of a contact person of each start-up (not an external third party) who can confirm the information provided by the tenderer, as well as a project name and description describing the services provided. The client reserves the right to verify the information provided by the tenderer. For group of tenderers, it must be clear which reference project belongs to which member. The reference projects of the members fulfilling the minimum requirements are attributed to the group. Per reference project, max. 5 one-sided printed DIN-A-4 pages with an additional presentation of the reference project are admissible and will be considered. Should reference projects be named elsewhere or beyond (eg also in general office brochures, reference lists, etc.), these will not be considered.
The following minimum requirements for the type and content of the reference projects apply. If not all the minimum requirements for the reference projects are met, the initial offer is excluded:
— Proof of the successful financing of at least 5 healthcare startups (from the fields of medical technology, biotechnology or digital health) from the period 1.1.2015 to 31.12.2017,
— Successful financing in this sense means: the financing volume of these startups, mediated by the tenderer, is at least 750 000 EUR.
3— Proof of at least 5000 registered platform users in each of the last 3 completed financial years (2015-2017).
For further details see section 4.2.2.4.1 of the document “EIT Health - Concession documents - FINAL.pdf” in the most recent version (link: https://fileshare.eithealth.eu/url/cf).

INFO_ADD.P: For the purpose of the initial tender please use the applicants form for declarations and supporting documents as required by Sections III.1.1-III.1.3 of the concession notice and section 4.2.2.4.1 of the document “EIT Health - Concession documents - FINAL.pdf”.
